value.title: Detroit Police Chief: Facial Recognition Software Misidentifies 96% of the Time
value.excerpt: In a public meeting Monday, Detroit Police Chief James Craig admitted that the technology, developed by a company called DataWorks Plus, almost never brings back a direct match and almost always misidentifies people.

images.title: Detroit Police Chief: Facial Recognition Software Misidentifies 96% of the Time

value.title: São Paulo subway facial recognition system slammed over user data security and privacy

value.title: Man wrongfully arrested due to facial recognition software talks about 'humiliating' experience

value.title: The little-known AI firms whose facial recognition tech led to a false arrest

value.title: A Flawed Facial Recognition System Sent This Man to Jail

value.title: Boston Bans Police Forces From Using Facial Recognition

value.title: ACLU files first formal complaint over wrongful facial recognition arrest
value.excerpt: The American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) has filed a formal complaint against Detroit police over what it says is the first known example of a wrongful arrest caused by faulty facial recognition technology.
